content.description:
Outstanding!

Hard slab right off the ground followed by a seam that will test you crack climbing skills. Technical and sustained

There is a significant runout near the top of the route that can be avoided by placing a small finger sized cam.
content.location: Next route to the right of Anxiety Attack

content.description:
Superb climb with mix of different climbing styles. start on the slab after tunneling through bushes/trees to get to the base. clip some bolts, pulling a 9+/10a move that might be semi-dynamic, then 5.9- up cracks, blocks, bulges, and seams to the top.

This is a new route not mentioned in the guide-pamphlet topo.
content.location: immediately left of Mostly Harmless (the polished slab route that you cannot miss)

content.description: Steep and sporty. Follow the line of bolts as it diagonals up and right the exposed arete.
content.location: Walk past the start of Nosedive and Flying Camel, and scramble up a short 4th class section to reach a sloping ledge with bolted anchors. This marks the start of the climb.

content.description: A fun, bolt-protected climb on mostly good rock. Follow the arete to bolted rappel anchors.
content.location: 20 ft right of Wyonna's Big Brown Beaver.

content.description: A great, sustained climb with a demanding crux and technical face climbing on thin edges. Climb up the steep broken crack to a V-slot (crux) and then continue up the face performing delicate moves on thin but positive edges. Overall, a well-protected route that takes good gear before reaching the first bolt.
content.protection:
Bolts, cams to 1"

Save a green alien for the top half of the route
content.location: About 30ft right from the start of Vaino's Route.

climbs.name: Mostly Harmless
climbs.fa: Randy DeWees, Mallory DeWees, Tim Veazy

content.description:
Trust your rubber on this one!

Follow the bolts up the low angle slab. The crux is getting to the high first bolt and involves thin edging and smearing on very polished rock.
content.location: Locate the low angle slab, 30 left of Seven Draws

content.description: Climb a crack that takes good pro, then face climb past 4 well-spaced bolts to the top of the wall. Overall, a great climb with varied climbing and a well-protected crux.
content.protection:
Single set of cams to 3"

4 bolts. Bolted anchors
content.location: Locate the prominent crack 20 ft to the right of Nosedive. This marks the start of the climb.

content.description: From the bolted anchors of Seven Draws, traverse left and then follow the bolted line up to the top of the wall. Consider extending or back-cleaning the first bolt to reduce rope drag.
content.location:
To get to this route, climb either Wyonna's BBB or Seven Draws to the bolted anchors about halfway up the wall. From the anchors, traverse left to reach the bolted line.

To descend, perform 2 rappels with a 70m rope. Otherwise, rappel with two ropes.

climbs.name: Anxiety Attack
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger, Mark Krebs, Matt Chambers - 12/2015

content.description:
Another great route at New Directions. Although the crux comes high up towards the end of the climb, both pitches offer quality climbing on good rock.

P1. Climb up the crack system all the way to a small alcove under a roof. Bolted anchor.

P2. Continue following the crack/corner until reaching a face protected by bolts. Follow the bolts to the top of the wall.

To descend, use the bolted anchors at the top of Boot Laeger. Two rappels with a 70m rope will get you safe to the ground.
content.protection: Gear to 4" plus draws for the bolted face on P2. Bolted Anchors.
content.location: Locate the right facing corner just right of Seven Draws.

content.description:
This is a well protected climb and easily done in one pitch.

Climb up the middle of the wall, clipping some bolts along the way. Set up a belay at a bolted anchor or continue climbing up, moving slightly right and closer to the arete, clipping a few more bolts, to the top of the route.
content.protection:
Bring draws, and pro to 1"

Bolted anchors at the top
